title: Old-style text font
content:
What is this font? Note tight curve at top of f, p in italic has bowl closing with a swell and no contact with stem, U has serifed stem on right side, M with sloped verticals.  
Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100228214907im_/http:/typophile.com/files/textfontal_5233.jpg)
author: MichaelS

comments.content: Very close to Plantin, except for the U.

I think it's Regent. FontHaus and Storm each have versions.

Found using Serif Font ID Guide.

- Mike Yanega
Solved in 2! It's Regent! Thanks, Mike
